intro: Mitrasacme distylis, commonly known as the two-styled mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers with distinct stamens and two separate styles, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral morphology and ecological adaptations.
